weather_report:
As the city lies quietly in the early hours, a gentle coolness wraps around Downtown San Francisco, hinting at the charm of the night. The forecast whispers of a mostly sunny Friday ahead, where the sun will rise gracefully to unveil a day painted with soft golden hues. Although the temperature is set to reach a comfortable 60 degrees, it will dip slightly as the afternoon unfolds, merging with the crispness of the air. The light breeze, brushing at around nine miles per hour, carries the fresh scent of the bay, adding to the serenity of this delightful morning.

Now, as the sun begins to stretch its limbs, it is likely that a fleeting marine layer still lingers close to the horizon, though it shall disperse, making way for clearer skies. The fog, while a quintessential companion of the Bay Area, seems notably absent from the morning canvas. For those stepping out, layers are advisable; a light jacket will serve well against the morning chill, yet might be shed as warmth creeps in. There’s much to enjoy today—take a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or pause at a vibrant café, inhaling the aroma of freshly brewed coffee while watching the city awaken. The day promises the simple pleasure of being embraced by the soft sun, with moments inviting one to appreciate the beauty that lingers in the detail.
